analyzed_papers.title: Epistemic Traps: Rational Misalignment Driven by Model Misspecification
key_contributions: Berk-Nash Rationalizability framework for AI
Phase space analysis of AI safety
Rationalizability of sycophancy, hallucination, strategic deception
Subjective Model Engineering (SME) as new paradigm
Safety as discrete phase determined by epistemic priors

analyzed_papers.title: The Geometry of Noise: Why Diffusion Models Don't Need Noise Conditioning
key_contributions: Marginal Energy formalization for autonomous diffusion models
Riemannian gradient flow interpretation of generation
Geometric singularity analysis (1/t^p singularity)
Stability theory: bounded-gain condition for velocity-based models
Jensen Gap explanation for noise-prediction catastrophic failure

analyzed_papers.title: OPUS: Towards Efficient and Principled Data Selection in Large Language Model Pre-training in Every Iteration
key_contributions: Optimizer-induced utility as theoretically grounded objective
Closed-form approximations for AdamW and Muon effective updates
Bench-Proxy: retrieval-based in-distribution proxy construction
Ghost technique + CountSketch for efficient utility estimation
Boltzmann sampling for diversity preservation
4.7% compute overhead with per-step selection
2-8Ã— data efficiency gains across models/scales

analyzed_papers.title: Interaction Theater: A case of LLM Agents Interacting at Scale
key_contributions: Interaction Theater framework: diverse text without substantive exchange
Agent Behavioral Entropy: Shannon entropy + Self-NCD for diversity analysis
Information Saturation: rapid decay to <10% novelty by comment 30
Post-Comment Relevance: 65% of comments share no vocabulary with posts
Semantic Validation: embedding-based analysis confirming lexical findings
LLM-as-Judge: 28% spam, 22% off-topic, only 13.2% substantive
Nested Reply Analysis: only 5% threaded replies, 95% independent top-level
Coordination mechanisms must be explicitly designed, not assumed
Surface metrics (activity volume) are unreliable quality signals

analyzed_papers.title: AgentInit: Initializing LLM-based Multi-Agent Systems via Diversity and Expertise Orchestration for Effective and Efficient Collaboration
key_contributions: Standardized Agent Generation: Planner + Observer + Formatter agents
Balanced Team Selection: Pareto optimization of relevance and diversity
Vendi Score: Eigenvalue-based entropy metric for team diversity
Multi-round iterative refinement with feedback mechanism
NL-to-Format: Natural language to standardized format conversion
Performance improvement: +1.0 to +1.3 points average across benchmarks
Token reduction: 15-30% reduction in token usage
Cross-framework generalization: AutoGen and Graph-based structures
Initial condition optimization: Reducing entropy at system initialization
